intro: Anaphalis undulata, commonly known as the wavy cottonweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces fluffy, white inflorescences that resemble cotton, giving it its common name. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Anaphalis undulata is typically herbaceous, with slender stems and small, narrow leaves.
